title: ggplot2 extenders ü´ñ
text: ggplot2 extenders meets in virtually to hear extenders talk through motivation, origins, and challenges of their extension projects!

title: ggplot-extension-club
text:
A repository as a discussion place for extending the ggplot2 R package.
As a bit of background: some people have been meeting virtually every few months and discussing ggplot2 extension.
Upcoming meeting:

{animint2}, Toby Hocking, August 19, 2024

Past meetings

{ggnewscale}, Elio Campitelli, June 22/23, 2024
{ggedit}, Jonathan Sidi, May 11, 2024
A conversation with Di Cook {GGally}, March 12/13, 2024
{ggdag}, Malcolm Barrett, Feb 10, 2024
{ggflowchart} Nicola Rennie & {arrowheadr} W. Joel Schneider Nov 4, 2023
{ggeasy} Jonathan Carroll, Sept 2, 2023
{ggsurvfit}, Daniel Sjoberg, June 10, 2023
{ggcirclepack}, Gina Reynolds, April 15, 2023
Fundamentals of Data Visualization, Claus Wilke, Jan 28, 2022
{ggtrace}, June Choe, July 16, 2022
{ggh4x}, Teun Van Den Brand, June 11, 2022
{geomtextpath} Allan Cameron May 7, 2022
{ggbump} David Sjoberg, April 9, 2022
First meeting, March 19, 2022

This repository will accommodate some discussion outside those meetings and coordination efforts. Feel free to participate in discussions and be in touch!

title: ggplot2 extenders ü´ñ
text:
Unlike other forums, the ggplot2 extenders discussion forum isn‚Äôt so much about efficiently communicating a question and getting the answer. It‚Äôs more about facilitating discussions and allowing people to put their experiences and ideas into words.
Check out our online discussion forum where you can contribute to existing threads or bring up new topics. Hot topics include practical questions on API for diverging bar charts and annotating a single facet as well as more theoretical terrain about ggproto inheritance.

title: ggplot2 extenders ü´ñ
text:
Check out the beginner-friendly ‚Äòeasy geom_*() recipes‚Äô, which have been tested by new-comers, vetted by experts, is feedback refined via surveys and focus groups, and are kept up to date (soon incorporating ggplot2 4.0.0 release developments). You can also check out the under-development ggplot2 extension cookbook for more extension moves.
Additional unaffiliated educational resources include the extending ggplot2 chapters of the ggplot2 book (Programming with ggplot2, ggplot2 internals, Writing ggplot2 extensions, Case Study: Springs); the extending ggplot2 vignette; and the ggproto tag on StackOverflow. The talks Extending your ability to extend ggplot2 by Thomas Lin Pederson at rstudio::conf 2020 and Best practises for programming with ggplot2 by Dewey Dunnington at rstudio::conf 2020, Cracking open ggplot internals with {ggtrace} by June Choe at rstudio::conf 2022 might also help orient you.
Additional resources include the ggplot2 repository, the extensions gallery, the Awesome ggplot2 repository.
